result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig R Kerscher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Marijuana. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay $150 forfeiture plus costs. 60 days to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

and verdict by Defendant

Defendant Craig R Kerscher in court with attorney Aaron Schenk. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of plea agreement, moves to amend Count 2 to County ordinance, recommends $150 fine plus costs, makes statement regarding sentencing. Defense enters no contest plea on Defendant's behalf to amended Count 2, makes statement regarding incident. Defendant makes statement. Bar owner makes statement. Court grants motion to amend, finds Defendant guilty of amended Count 2, dismisses but will read in Counts 1 and 3, imposes $150 fine plus costs.
from State to Court objecting to Defendant's proposed jury instruction 860

Attorney Aaron Schenk appeared by phone. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises that case is resolved, advises of plea agreement. Defense agrees, could be here Wednesday morning to enter plea. Court advises that jury would not be called off until plea is entered. Defense is in all day divorce trial tomorrow in Oconto County, indicates as officer of Court that Defendant will not be backing out of deal. State advises that he has been in regular contact with Defense and both have long thought matter should be resolved short of trial. Court will allow plea to be entered on Wednesday, will cancel jury.

Defendant Craig R Kerscher in court with attorney Aaron Schenk who appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schenk indicates this matter is still proceeding to trial on 11/30/16. Atty Schenk indicates defense is willing to stipulate that substance taken from the scene of the crime was THC. Court questions defendant on stipulation, defendant agrees with stipulation of counsel. Court indicates this matter is in the #2 position for trial.  Court addresses State's motion to impeach. Defense has no objection to motion. Court grants motion.  Discussion regarding proposed jury instructions. Nothing further needed today. Bond remains in effect.
from Atty Schenk to Court requesting phone appearance. Per State, no objection as long as Defendant is personally here on 11/14. Per Court, granted to appear at pretrial by phone.
by State to impeach with evidence of prior convictions if the Defendant testifies

Defendant Craig R Kerscher in court with attorney Aaron Schenk. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that case is not resolved, but he's not convinced case won't settle. Defense moves to adjourn trial due to trial in another county. State has no objection. Court will grant request if case can be heard before March 1 due to retirement. Discussion regarding stipulation to eliminate need for analyst, potential number 2 positions. Defense/Defendant are not opposed to putting case off until new judge is in place. Defense makes statement regarding stipulation that substance was THC, substance found on paraphernalia was THC. Bond remains in effect.  Jury trial scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

No contact direct or indirect with JF.

Defendant Craig R Kerscher in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.
